Institution: Oxford University  
Study Purpose: To conduct a comprehensive study on the cognitive development of children from birth to the age of five.  
Study Duration: 5 years  
Inclusion Criteria: We are seeking children aged 0-5 years, born in Oxfordshire, and their parents who are willing to participate in our study.  
Exclusion Criteria: Children with any known medical conditions, and their parents unwilling to participate in the study.  

______________________________
**POTENTIAL RISKS & BENEFITS**
______________________________

Possible Risks: It is important to note that some individuals may experience anxiety or discomfort during the study. Participants are fully informed of the potential risks and have the option to withdraw at any time.  
Expected Benefits: The research will yield significant insights into the cognitive development of children, potentially leading to enhanced educational strategies and policies.  
Confidentiality: All data collected will be treated with the utmost confidentiality and anonymization. Participants will be assigned unique identification numbers, and their personal information will be kept strictly confidential and will not be shared with any external parties.  

______________________________
**PARTICIPATION AND WITHDRAWAL**
______________________________

Participation in this study is voluntary. You are free to choose not to participate, or you may withdraw at any time without any effect on your relationship with the institution or your access to medical treatment. There will be no negative consequences for choosing not to participate or for withdrawing from the study.

______________________________

______________________________
**GDPR RIGHTS & INFORMATION**
______________________________

You have the right to access, correct, or delete your personal data, and consent is voluntary. You may withdraw your consent at any time, which will not affect your right to medical treatment or participation in other studies.

**PROCEDURE DETAILS**
______________________________

Name of Procedure: Cardiac Catheterization  
Date of Procedure: 02/23/2022  
Procedure Description: A minimally invasive diagnostic method for identifying arterial blockages in the heart's blood supply involves the insertion of a slender, flexible tube through the wrist or groin region. This tube, known as a catheter, is then guided through the blood vessels to the heart, where it is equipped with a contrast agent that produces a clear image on an X-ray.  

______________________________
**RISKS & EXPECTED OUTCOMES**
______________________________

Possible Risks: Potential complications may encompass bleeding, infection, hypersensitivity to the contrast agent, and arterial or cardiac damage. Additionally, there is a risk of myocardial infarction or cerebral vasculature damage during the procedure.  
Expected Outcomes: Cardiac catheterization is a diagnostic procedure that can identify potential blockages in the arteries that may be causing symptoms such as chest pain. If blockages are detected, they can be addressed through the use of medications or surgical interventions like angioplasty or bypass surgery.
